1.subtask_description: Identify five most populous cities in India and provide a concise summary.

1.handles: Retrieves an initial list of five most populous Indian cities

input_vars.name: query_populous_cities_initial
input_vars.description: The user request about the top five most populous cities in India
input_vars.value: [{"role":"user","content":"List the 5 most populous cities of India."}]

output_vars.name: initial_city_list
output_vars.description: Initial list of five populous cities in India

2.handles: Confirms or refines the list of five cities

input_vars.name: initial_city_list
input_vars.description: Array with user message referencing the initial list of cities for confirmation

output_vars.name: top_five_cities
output_vars.description: Final verified list of five most populous cities in India

2.subtask_description: Provide pairwise distances between the five identified cities.

1.handles: Retrieves approximate distances among the five cities

input_vars.name: top_five_cities
input_vars.description: The final verified list of five most populous cities in India

input_vars.name: query_approx_distances
input_vars.description: Additional user message requesting approximate distances
input_vars.value: [{"role":"user","content":"What are the approximate distances among these 5 cities in India?"}]

output_vars.name: approximate_distance_info
output_vars.description: Summary or approximate distances among the five cities
output_vars.value:
"Here are the approximate distances among Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, Bangalore, and Chennai, India’s major metropolises (all distances in kilometers):

| City Pair             | Approx. Road Distance (km) |
|-----------------------|----------------------------|
| Delhi – Mumbai        | 1,419                      |
| Delhi – Kolkata       | 1,453                      |
| Delhi – Chennai       | 2,191                      |
| Delhi – Bangalore     | 2,096                      |
| Mumbai – Kolkata      | 1,670                      |
| Mumbai – Chennai      | 1,290                      |
| Mumbai – Bangalore    | 1,019                      |
| Kolkata – Chennai     | 1,684                      |
| Kolkata – Bangalore   | 1,300                      |
| Bangalore – Chennai   | 350                        |

- These distances are based on major National Highway routes, especially the Golden Quadrilateral network.
- Straight-line distances are generally shorter than road distances.
- The Golden Quadrilateral highway system connects Delhi, Mumbai, Kolkata, and Chennai in a four-sided network, with Bangalore also well connected.
- Actual travel times may vary depending on the mode of transport and chosen route.

Sources: [distancecalculator.globefeed.com](https://distancecalculator.globefeed.com/India_Distance_Calculator.asp), [Wikipedia: Golden Quadrilateral](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Golden_Quadrilateral), and others as cited in the TOOL response."

2.handles: Calculates the pairwise driving distances among the five cities

input_vars.name: top_five_cities
input_vars.description: Final verified list of five cities used as origins

input_vars.name: top_five_cities
input_vars.description: Final verified list of five cities used as destinations

input_vars.name: driving_mode
input_vars.description: Travel mode is set to driving

output_vars.name: distances_table
output_vars.description: Pairwise driving distances between the five cities
